Description: Report on Founders Fund buying into the legal marijuana industry. Framed as a "hard-nosed capitalist" spotting value in taboo sectors.
Coverage of Thiel "secretly bankrolling" the Hulk Hogan suit. Framed as a moral act of justice against a "singularly terrible bully" (Gawker).
Thiel's historic speech claiming "America has not progressed." TWT highlights his "builder" vs "insider" critique of the economy.
Thiel denies rumors he is buying The Washington Times. Validates the paper as a strategic asset while clarifying his media strategy.
Thiel gives direct quotes criticizing the Army's "DCGS" system. TWT serves as the venue for his war against Pentagon bureaucracy.
Thiel accuses Google of being "seemingly treasonous" for China work. TWT amplifies his call for CIA/FBI investigations.
Reports on the "Peter Thiel network" anointing J.D. Vance and Blake Masters. Described as "grooming" a New Right cadre.
Blake Masters wins primary. TWT frames it as a victory for the "Trump-Thiel alliance" over establishment GOP money.
Op-eds defending Thiel against proposed "unrealized gains" taxes. Thiel used as the symbol of innovation threatened by tax overreach.
Thiel listed as a "spiritual godfather" to the Department of Government Efficiency (Musk/Ramaswamy). The "disruptor" finally enters the bureaucracy.

Key Events/Topics: Marijuana investment, Roth IRA, Unrealized Gains Tax

Key Quote/Headline: "I have no plans to buy the Washington Times"
"Peter Thiel, Mercers Back Potential J.D. Vance Run"
